intro: Pentacarya, commonly known as the star-leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble a star, hence its common name. Pentacarya species typically have small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in complex inflorescences. These plants are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
